newsitem.title: USA: Senetek study shows impotence drug works.
newsitem.headline: Senetek study shows impotence drug works.

text.p: Senetek Plc said Tuesday its Invicorp drug successfully treated 70 percent of impotent men participating in a clinical study whose dysfunction had been resistant to previous drug therapies.
The trial, conducted on 70 patients in Belfast, Northern Ireland, follows a Phase III clinical trial on 700 patients in Britain that achieved a success rate of 81 percent, the company said.
The company said last month it filed a product licensing application with the United Kingdom's Medicines Control Agency seeking to market Invicorp to treat moderate-to-severe male impotence.
The primary side effect of the drug is short-term facial flushing, the company said.
